definition: to ascend/to rise to the rank of/to promote/to hoist/liter/measure for dry grain equal to one-tenth dou 斗[dou3]
variant of 升[sheng1]/to ascend/to rise in rank
banner/flag/(in Qing times) Manchu (cf. 八旗[Ba1 qi2])/administrative subdivision in inner Mongolia equivalent to 縣|县[xian4] county/CL:面[mian4]

sentences.english: I watched the Flag - raising Ceremony yesterday.
sentences.chinese: 昨天我去观看升旗仪式了。

sentences.english: The flag- rasing ceremony of Shenzhen Futian Free Trade Zone Pirmary School now begins.
sentences.chinese: 深圳市福田保税区小学第周升旗仪式现在开始。

sentences.english: Guards of honor convoy the national flag enter the site of the raising ceremony.
sentences.chinese: 仪仗兵护卫国旗进入升旗仪式现场。

sentences.english: National Day is commemorated every year by special flag-raising ceremonies.
sentences.chinese: 每一年的国庆节都是从特殊的升旗仪式开始庆祝的。

sentences.english: About 2, 600 people watched the flag-raising ceremony in the square.
sentences.chinese: 广场上大约2，600人观看了升旗仪式。

sentences.english: The week flag-raising ceremony of Liyuchi Primary school now is beginning.
sentences.chinese: 鲤鱼池小学升旗仪式现在开始。

sentences.english: This week hoisted a flag the ceremony finally to manage by our Class Two, Grade One.
sentences.chinese: 本周一的升旗仪式由我们初一年级二班来主持。

sentences.english: After the flag-raising ceremony, we ate lunch.
sentences.chinese: 升旗仪式结束后，我们便吃了午饭。

sentences.english: National flag-raising ceremony held in Yushu .
sentences.chinese: 玉树举行迎国庆升旗仪式。

sentences.english: The flag-raising ceremony was held to mark the eighth anniversary of the region's return to the Chinese motherland.
sentences.chinese: 升旗仪式的举行是为了纪念澳门回归祖国八周年。

sentences.english: The flag-raising ceremony ended, all classes get back in order!
sentences.chinese: 升旗仪式到此结束，请各班有秩序带回。

sentences.english: The ceremony was chaired by the Macao Special Administrative Region (MSAR) Chief Executive Edmund Ho Hau Wah.
sentences.chinese: 升旗仪式由澳门特别行政区长官何厚铧主持。

definition: to raise a flag/to hoist a flag
setting-up exercises during the break (between classes)
honor guard/guard of honor/the banner bearing contingent leading a military procession
morning exercises (physical exercises commonly performed en masse at schools and workplaces in East Asian countries)
to drill/to exercise/to go outdoors for physical exercise
